MolModMT

Quick Guide¶

Import the multitool library a start working with its help in tasks such as those mentioned here below:

[1]:

import molmodmt as molmodmt

Fetching molecular systems from web databases¶

You probably don’t remember how to fetch a pdb from the protein data bank to be loaded in your script as a parmed, pdbfixer, mdtraj, nglview, pytraj or mdanalysis native object -just to mention some-. MolModMT has a unique command to do it:

[2]:

system_parmed     = molmodmt.fetch('pdb:1sux',form='parmed')
system_pdbfixer   = molmodmt.fetch('pdb:1sux',form='pdbfixer')
system_mdtraj     = molmodmt.fetch('pdb:1sux',form='mdtraj')
system_mdanalysis = molmodmt.fetch('pdb:1sux',form='mdanalysis')
system_nglview    = molmodmt.fetch('pdb:1sux',form='nglview')
system_pytraj     = molmodmt.fetch('pdb:1sux',form='pytraj')

The class, or in MolModMT syntaxis, the form of each object can be checked as:

[3]:

print(molmodmt.get_form(system_parmed))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_pdbfixer))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_mdtraj))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_mdanalysis))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_nglview))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_pytraj))

parmed.Structure
pdbfixer.PDBFixer
mdtraj.Trajectory
mdanalysis.Universe
nglview

Loading molecular systems and trajectories¶

Some files with different formats of molecular systems are stored in MolModMT as example:

[4]:

molmodmt.utils.examples.pdb

[4]:

{'1l2y': '/home/diego/Myusr/src/UIBCDFGitHub/LabTools/MolModMT/molmodmt/utils/data/pdb/1l2y.pdb',
 '1li2': '/home/diego/Myusr/src/UIBCDFGitHub/LabTools/MolModMT/molmodmt/utils/data/pdb/1li2.pdb'}

[5]:

molmodmt.utils.examples.mol2

[5]:

{'caffeine': '/home/diego/Myusr/src/UIBCDFGitHub/LabTools/MolModMT/molmodmt/utils/data/mol2/caffeine.mol2'}

Lets work with some of the to show how MolModMT can load them in several forms:

[6]:

PDB_example_file = molmodmt.utils.examples.pdb['1l2y']
MOL2_example_file = molmodmt.utils.examples.mol2['caffeine']

[7]:

system_pdbfixer = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'pdbfixer')
system_parmed   = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'parmed')
system_modeller = molmodmt.load(MOL2_example_file,'modeller')
system_mdtraj   = molmodmt.load(MOL2_example_file,'mdtraj')

/home/diego/Myusr/opt/miniconda3/envs/MolModMT_dev/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pandas/io/parsers.py:2230: FutureWarning: split() requires a non-empty pattern match.
  yield pat.split(line.strip())
/home/diego/Myusr/opt/miniconda3/envs/MolModMT_dev/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pandas/io/parsers.py:2232: FutureWarning: split() requires a non-empty pattern match.
  yield pat.split(line.strip())

[8]:

print(molmodmt.get_form(system_pdbfixer))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_parmed))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_modeller))
print(molmodmt.get_form(system_mdtraj))

pdbfixer.PDBFixer
parmed.Structure
modeller.Modeller
mdtraj.Trajectory

Converting molecular systems and trajectories¶

Systems can be easily converted to the native object of other libraries as:

[9]:

system_modeller = molmodmt.convert(PDB_example_file,form='modeller')

[10]:

molmodmt.get_form(system_modeller)

[10]:

'modeller.Modeller'

[11]:

system_mdtraj = molmodmt.convert(system_modeller,form='mdtraj')

[12]:

molmodmt.get_form(system_mdtraj)

[12]:

'mdtraj.Trajectory'

[13]:

system_parmed = molmodmt.convert(system_mdtraj,form='parmed')

[14]:

molmodmt.get_form(system_parmed)

[14]:

'parmed.Structure'

Working with id codes¶

[ ]:

system_mdtraj = molmodmt.convert('pdb:1sux','mdtraj')

Working with sequences¶

[ ]:

system_aminoacids1 = molmodmt.convert('aminoacids3:TyrGlyGlyPheMet','aminoacids1:seq')

[ ]:

system_aminoacids3 = molmodmt.convert('aminoacids1:YGGFM','aminoacids3:seq')

[ ]:

system_biopython = molmodmt.convert('aminoacids1:YGGFM','biopython.SeqRecord')

Writting molecular systems or trajectories as files¶

[15]:

system_parmed   = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'parmed')

[16]:

molmodmt.write(system_parmed,'foo.mol2')

[ ]:

molmodmt.convert('pdb:1sux','1sux.pdb')

[ ]:

molmodmt.convert('aminoacids1:YGGFM','metenk.fasta')

[17]:

from os import remove
remove('foo.mol2','1sux.pdb','metenk.fasta')

Atoms selection¶

[18]:

system_mdtraj     = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'mdtraj')
system_pdbfixer   = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'pdbfixer')
system_mdanalysis = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'mdanalysis')
system_parmed     = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'parmed')

/home/diego/Myusr/opt/miniconda3/envs/MolModMT_dev/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mdtraj/formats/pdb/pdbfile.py:196: UserWarning: Unlikely unit cell vectors detected in PDB file likely resulting from a dummy CRYST1 record. Discarding unit cell vectors.
  warnings.warn('Unlikely unit cell vectors detected in PDB file likely '

[19]:

molmodmt.select(system_mdtraj,'name CA and resid 10 to 20')

[19]:

array([177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293])

[20]:

molmodmt.select(system_pdbfixer,'name CA and resid 10 to 20')

[20]:

array([177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293])

[21]:

molmodmt.select(system_mdanalysis,'name CA and resid 10 to 20')

  particle_density = traj.top.n_atoms / traj.unitcell_volumes[0]

[21]:

array([177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293])

[22]:

molmodmt.select(system_parmed,'name CA and resid 10 to 20')

[22]:

array([177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293])

[23]:

molmodmt.select(PDB_example_file,'name CA and resid 10 to 20')

[23]:

array([177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293])

[24]:

molmodmt.select("pdb:1l2y",'name CA and resid 10 to 20')

[24]:

array([177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293])

[25]:

molmodmt.select(system_mdanalysis,'name CA and (resid 10:20)','mdanalysis')

[25]:

array([171, 178, 185, 199, 210, 221, 228, 252, 266, 280, 294])

[26]:

molmodmt.select(system_parmed,':10-20@CA','parmed')

[26]:

[170, 177, 184, 198, 209, 220, 227, 251, 265, 279, 293]

Viewing molecular systems and trajectories¶

[27]:

view=molmodmt.view(MOL2_example_file)
view

[28]:

view.render_image()

[29]:

view._display_image()

[29]:

[30]:

view=molmodmt.view('pdb:1l2y')
view

[31]:

view.render_image()

[32]:

view._display_image()

[32]:

[33]:

system_pdbfixer = molmodmt.load(PDB_example_file,'pdbfixer')
view=molmodmt.view(system_pdbfixer)
view

[34]:

view.render_image()

[35]:

view._display_image()

[35]:

Molecular systems as MolModMT’s forms¶

MolModMT’s works with methods as load or convert over different forms of a molecular model. This way, the same molecular model can take de form of a pdb file, a parmed structure or a pytraj object. In order to list the different forms MolModMT currently recognize, check the method info_forms:

[36]:

molmodmt.info_forms()

[36]:

{'engines': ['mdanalysis',
  'mdtraj',
  'modeller',
  'native',
  'openmm',
  'parmed',
  'pdbfixer'],
 'classes': ['mdanalysis.Universe',
  'mdtraj.Topology',
  'mdtraj.Trajectory',
  'modeller.Modeller',
  'moldyn.Native',
  'molsys.Native',
  'openmm.Positions',
  'openmm.Topology',
  'parmed.Structure',
  'pdbfixer.PDBFixer',
  'yank.Topography'],
 'files': ['dcd', 'ddb', 'h5', 'mol2', 'pdb', 'sdf', 'smi', 'xtc'],
 'ids': ['pdb:id']}

In addition the list of forms which can be loaded to another given form can be checked with:

[37]:

molmodmt.info_load(to_form='pdb')

['mdanalysis.Universe', 'mdtraj.Trajectory', 'modeller.Modeller', 'mol2', 'molsys.Native', 'parmed', 'parmed.Structure', 'pdb:id', 'pdbfixer.PDBFixer']

And the other way around, the lisf of forms a given form can be loaded as can also be checked with:

[38]:

molmodmt.info_load(from_form='pdbfixer')

['mdtraj']
